name: Senator Brian Schatz

tweet_text: We just moved one step closer to protecting sharks from finning – the brutal practice of slicing fins off of live sharks and throwing the remainder of the animal back into the ocean to die a slow death.

tweet_text: This bill will put federal funding in the hands of states and territories to manage and restore reefs – a major step forward.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: My legislation to protect coral reefs was just included in the National Defense Authorization Act. Our coral reefs have been pushed to the brink of extinction, and we need to act now to save them.

name: Senator Brian Schatz

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text:
This bill would require the Fed to do its job and make sure our largest financial institutions are resilient to climate risks to avoid a financial crisis.

https://t.co/ucidqR1Tt6

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: Financial stability is part of the Fed’s mandate, and regulators in other countries are already working to quantify and manage climate risks. Why is the Fed lagging behind?

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: Banks face the risk of direct losses from climate change, not just in the distant future but now. But, like the housing bubble in 2007, our regulators are ignoring these risks.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: Climate change lowers labor productivity, stresses farm output, hurts property values, and disrupts supply chains. No part of our economy will be spared.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: Climate change is a major risk we are ignoring. It is increasing severe floods and wildfires, driving sea level rise and dangerous heat waves. These events are happening more often and causing more damage. These events hurt the economy.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: When we ignore risks in our financial system, we risk a crisis that harms the whole economy and wipes out household wealth, as we saw in 2008.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: Today, #KingKamehamehaDay, Senator Schatz delivered a major floor speech urging equal treatment for Native Hawaiians. http://t.co/7M7QmyPzg4

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: That is why today - on Kamehameha Day - I call upon all of us to join in the fight for justice for Native Hawaiians.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: It is long past time for the Native Hawaiian people to regain their right to self-governance.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: Separate is not equal, and that is why I urge the federal government to treat Native Hawaiians fairly.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: ...data reveals persistent health, education, and income disparities.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: Although Congress has passed more than 150 statutes to address negative effects of earlier federal actions...

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: ...to provide a process for reorganizing a Native Hawaiian governing entity.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: It has been 20 years since the Apology Resolution, but the federal government has not yet acted...

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: In 1993, the Congress passed, and President Clinton signed, the Apology Resolution, a formal acknowledgement and apology.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: Congress has consistently recognized Native Hawaiians as native peoples on whose behalf it may exercise its powers

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: Native Hawaiian children were punished for speaking Hawaiian, just as American Indians and Alaska Natives were...

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: These policies were as harmful and unjust to Native Hawaiians as they were to Alaska Natives and American Indians.

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: For almost two centuries federal policies of removal, relocation, assimilation & termination decimated Native communities

name: Senator Brian Schatz
tweet_text: Native Hawaiians...deserve access to the prevailing federal policy of self-determination.
